channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: After violent outbursts, court appearances and scandal, Naomi Campbell has a surprising new role
item.description: British supermodel Naomi Campbell, 51, has been announced as a Platinum Jubilee Global Ambassador for the Queen's Commonwealth Trust.

item.title: Prince William urges humanity 'not to give up' in the face of climate change
item.description: The future British king says he understands why people feel 'so despondent, so fearful and so powerless' in the face of a such a rapidly approaching 'tipping point'.

item.title: Council tax should be replaced with annual payment, think-tank says
item.description: Homeowners should pay an annual levy worth 0.5 per cent of the value of their home instead of council tax, a Labour-leaning think-tank has suggested.

item.title: Violence against women should be treated as seriously as TERRORISM, watchdog says
item.description: Police chiefs should treat violence against women as seriously as terrorism and stop ditching an 'eye-water- ing' number of crimes, a watchdog has said.

item.title: Energy prices soar by 19% after fire and maintenance shuts down key electricity cable in Kent
item.description: National Grid has warned that the blaze in Sellindge, Kent, damaged a major power cable which will remain totally offline until September 25 and partly offline until next March.

item.title: Energy prices soar by 19% after fire and maintenance shuts down key electricity cable in Kent
item.description: National Grid has warned that the blaze in Sellindge, Kent, damaged a major power cable which will remain totally offline until September 25 and partly offline until next March.

item.title: Troops injured on Army's £3.5b Ajax tanks could claim hundreds of thousands of pounds, lawyers say
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The Ministry of Defence could be forced to pay the staggering bills if troops can prove they have lost out on lengthy careers in the British Army.

item.title: Two men are charged with the murder of journalist Lyra Mckee
item.description: Ms McKee (pictured), 29, was shot dead by dissident republicans in Londonderry in April 2019 as she watched rioting in the Creggan area.

item.title: James Herriot and Co are still the best baa none: ROLAND WHITE reviews All Creatures Great And Small
item.description: ROLAND WHITE: The BBC's original series, based on James Herriot's books, ran for 90 episodes between 1978 and 1990; the signs suggest Channel 5's remake could last just as long.

item.title: Sir Clive Sinclair, brilliant inventor who brought home computing to the masses, has died at 81
item.description: With his bald head, beard and glasses, he was the archetypal boffin, and Sir Clive Sinclair, who has died today at the age of 81, came up with several eccentric inventions.

item.title: NABILA RAMDANI: Le humiliation as my pompous president takes a dive
item.description: To say the French are furious about being elbowed out of a lucrative contract to supply submarines to Australia is the understatement of the year. They are incandescent.

item.title: Long Covid symptoms in children and teens typically last between four and 12 weeks, analysis finds
item.description: A new study from the Murdoch Children's Research Institute, in Victoria, Australia found long-term Covid symptoms among children and teens resolved within four to 12 weeks.

item.title: Home computing pioneer Sir Clive Sinclair dies aged 81 after a long illness
item.description: The inventor and entrepreneur passed away at his home in London this morning, Belinda Sinclair said.

item.title: MARK ALMOND: Torpedoes are running for the Beijing bullies
item.description: Those who persist in the belief that Brexit means Britain turning in on itself had a rude awakening when Boris Johnson, Joe Biden and Australian PM Scott Morrison revealed a defence partnership.

item.title: School staff accidentally recorded themselves making jokes about six-year-old girl's tracheostomy
item.description: Staff from St Andrew's CofE Primary School, were talking about Willow Musgrave and the life-saving tracheostomy she has in her throat, which one said made her feel 'queasy'.

item.title: BBC braced for licence fee clash with new Culture Secretary Nadine Dorries
item.description: Nadine Dorries, who took over from Oliver Dowden in this week's Cabinet reshuffle, once described state-run television as 'more in keeping with a Soviet-style country'.

item.title: Hundreds of WWII operatives owed their lives to a small but plucky unit of gunboats
item.description: Tim Spicer, a former senior British Army officer, admits to a love of 'clandestine warfare . . . and lonely fighters'. And there is a treasure trove of both here in his book.

item.title: PCR tests will be axed, amber countries will turn green and red list will be halved under new plans
item.description: Under a shake-up, the double-jabbed will no longer have to take costly PCR tests when they return from abroad. But those who are not fully jabbed will have to quarantine.

item.title: CLAUDIA CONNELL imagines Harry's other life as hairdresser to his wife
item.description: Meghan, with a full head of voluminous hair, stood front and centre as Harry crouched behind her, basking in her glow.

item.title: Sir Trevor McDonald says the crimes of Fred and Rose West 'never leave you'
item.description: Speaking to The Telegraph, Sir Trevor, 82, said that he could not come to terms with the fact the Wests abused and killed their own children, saying: 'These things stay with you longer.'

item.title: HENRY DEEDES on Nadine Dorries' new role
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: Nadine Dorries's appointment as 'Minister for Fun' was the big surprise of Wednesday's reshuffle.

item.title: Patrick Dempsey accused of 'terrorizing the set' of Grey's Anatomy before his character was killed
item.description: The people behind the his medical drama opened up about the dark side of Dr. McDreamy in the oral history of the hit medical drama, How to Save a Life: The Inside Story Of Grey's Anatomy.

item.title: Lucy Mecklenburgh reveals her son Roman was rushed to hospital and put on a ventilator
item.description: The former TOWIE star, 30, took to Instagram on Thursday to tell fans about the health scare and admitted she and partner Ryan Thomas, 37, may 'never fully recover'.

item.title: Furious EU complains that it was 'not consulted' on AUKUS submarine deal
item.description: Josep Borrell, the EU's high representative for foreign affairs, said the union was only made aware of the new alliance between the UK, US and Australia through the media.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Boris Johnson must hope he catches Joe Biden on a good day
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Wouldn't you just love to be a fly on the wall when Boris Johnson meets Joe Biden in America next week?

item.title: Priti Patel visits Dover as around 100 migrants are intercepted in the Channel
item.description: The Home Secretary was seen talking to Border Force officers in the Kent port town on Thursday. The visit came on the same day around 100 migrants were intercepted in the Channel.

item.title: Who will win this year's Booker Prize? Our critics review the shortlisted novels
item.description: Nights are drawing in, so what better time to stock up on this year's Booker Prize shortlisted novels and enter a heated debate about who should win?

item.title: Why Father Brown's creator was no saint
item.description: British author G. K. Chesterton was a big man, weighing 20st and standing 6ft 2in. P. G. Wodehouse said the loudest noise imaginable would be 'G. K. Chesterton falling on a sheet of tin'.

item.title: Married at First Sight UK: Megan Wolfe says Alexis Conomoux gave her go ahead to kiss her husband
item.description: Married at First Sight UK viewers were left divided after Megan Wolfe accused Alexis of giving her the go ahead to kiss her husband behind her back - a claim which she strongly denied.

item.title: Florida poolside pic of fugitive Colombo consigliere that was posted by his SON is hurriedly deleted
item.description: The son of fugitive Ralph DiMatteo, 66, taunted FBI with a Florida poolside picture a day after other members of the Colombo family were arrested in New York City.

item.title: Mother who baby was killed in horror crash calls for drivers over 70 to be retested
item.description: Careering off the road, the van crashed into Louis' pushchair. The sleeping Louis, just five months old, was thrown out of his pram and died instantly in the accident in Waterbeach, Cambridge.

item.title: Nursing homes crippled because staff won't have the Covid vaccines now required by law
item.description: Care home bosses are describing sleepless nights as they battle what has felt like one crisis after another. First Covid, now a staffing shortage made worse by mandatory Covid vaccines.

item.title: Sylvester Stallone's movie memorabilia is being auctioned including his Rocky III boxing gloves
item.description: Sylvester Stallone's iconic movie memorabilia is going up for auction on December 5 at Julian's Auctions. On Thursday, the auction house announced that over 500 items would be for sale.

item.title: Prince Andrew challenges a High Court ruling that he can be served with papers over his US sex case
item.description: In what is being seen as another delaying tactic by Prince Andrew, who is currently at Balmoral with the Queen, his legal team said it would look to overturn the decision on a legal technicality.

item.title: French officials CANCEL gala dinner celebrating ties with US in protest at losing $90bn sub contract
item.description: French officials on Thursday canceled a gala to mark ties with the U.S. amid fury at Washington's role in wrecking a $90billion submarine deal with Australia.

item.title: Bloodbath Birmingham: Horrifying moment machete thugs attack rival on busy road
item.description: Dashcam footage shared on Twitter shows two men carrying a machete and a hammer setting upon a third man and swinging their weapons at him in Birmingham at around 4.20pm on Saturday.

item.title: Scottish Health Secretary furious after BBC journalist posts video of him falling off knee scooter
item.description: Scottish Health Secretary Humza Yousaf said he wasn't sure there was a 'need or purpose' for the short clip to be shared by Glenn Campbell after it began receiving thousands of 'likes' on Twitter.

item.title: Prince Charles and Camilla don tartan during a visit to Isle of Skye in Scotland
item.description: Prince Charles, 72 and Camilla, 74 looked to be in jovial spirits as they visited Portree in Scotland to see how businesses are moving forward following the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Boris finishes off his bombshell reshuffle with Red Wallers promoted
item.description: Boris Johnson has fuelled speculation about an early election by the scale of the changes to his top team - with new Tory chair Oliver Dowden telling staff last night to get ready for a vote in the next two years.

item.title: Almost 300 migratory birds are killed after slamming into New York's WTC in less than 24 hours
item.description: Melissa Breyer, a volunteer at NYC Audubon, picked up 291 dead birds outside of the World Trade Center towers on Tuesday. More birds are moving south as migration season starts.

item.title: Prince Philip's will is to remain SECRET for 90 years to protect the 'dignity' of the Queen
item.description: In a ruling published at London's High Court, Sir Andrew McFarlane ordered that Prince Philip's will is to remain sealed for 90 years and may only be opened in private even after that date.

item.title: Man who tried searching for birth parents found hanged in garage of adopted family, inquest hears
item.description: Ben Murphy, 22, who had embarked on a journey to discover his biological family, was found hanged in the garage of his adopted parents' home, a coroner heard.

item.title: Rio de Janeiro pregnant woman tries to jump out a window as 'abusive' husband holds her back
item.description: A a 10-weeks pregnant woman tried to jump from a second-floor window to escape the alleged beating inflicted by her husband before he dragged her back into their apartment in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.

item.title: Whales have five FINGERS hidden in their flippers that are a trait from their ancient ancestor
item.description: A researcher from Denmark shared images of a dissected whale's flipper, revealing there are five finger-like appendages hiding inside that are a trait from its land-based ancestor.

item.title: Government promises post-Brexit bonfire of EU red tape
item.description: Shops could soon be allowed to sell fruit and vegetables in pounds and ounces as part of a Government plan to hold a bonfire of EU red tape.

item.title: Sophie Wessex wears the robes of a Dame of the Order of St John in official portrait
item.description: The Countess of Wessex, 56, can be seen smiling as she wears the Robes of a Dame of the Order of St John in an official portrait released by Buckingham Palace.

item.title: The SS John Lewis: Department store charters fleet of ships to ensure stocks arrive for Christmas
item.description: John Lewis, alongside other UK retailers, has purchased extra vessels to speed up the delivery of orders such as Christmas trees and baubles in the run-up to the festive season.

item.title: Meghan Markle sported a staggering $384,000 worth of jewelry
item.description: Meghan Markle has claimed the pinky ring she wore on the cover of Time magazine was obtained by the stylist on the shoot directly from the designer, reported to be Lorraine Schwartz.

item.title: First booster Covid vaccines go into arms of NHS and care staff
item.description: About 32million Britons over the age of 50, as well as frontline health and care workers, are now eligible for third doses of Covid vaccines. They will be given Pfizer or Moderna.

item.title: Rolling Stone's goes woke and shunts Bob Dylan and John Lennon down top 500 song list for Aretha
item.description: Rolling Stone updated its list of the top 500 songs for the first time in 17 years, which saw Aretha Franklin and Public Enemy bumping out Bob Dylan and The Rolling Stones in the top two places.

item.title: England's cases drop by 15% in a week and outbreaks are shrinking in 92% of areas
item.description: Department of Health bosses posted another 22,949 infections today, down 15 per cent on the same time last week. It was the eighth day in a row that infections fell week-on-week.

item.title: NHS carried out 1MILLION fewer emergency procedures last year because of Covid
item.description: There were 5.45million emergency procedures carried out across all NHS England services in the 12 months to March, down 16 per cent on the 6.5m the previous year.

item.title: Woman finds a rotting HUMAN finger in her hamburger at fast food restaurant in Bolivia
item.description: Estefany Benitez visited a Hot Burger outlet in Santa Cruz de la Sierra on Sunday, one of her favourite food chains, but was shocked and disgusted to find the severed finger.

item.title: Schoolboy, nine, was mauled to death by dog when his mother left him alone in a caravan
item.description: Frankie MacRitchie, from Plymouth, received fatal head injuries after being attacked by the 45kg American bulldog cross Staffordshire bull terrier at Tencreek Holiday Park in Looe in April 2019.

item.title: Microsoft: Users can now delete all passwords from their accounts and log in with other methods
item.description: The move by the Redmond, Washington-based firm follows an initial rollout of the feature to Microsoft's business customers back in the March of this year.

item.title: The Insulate Britain protesters who strolled back onto the M25 after police let them walk free
item.description: Insulate Britain revealed that officers only bailed 17 of the 181 activists - many of whom have already been arrested twice - meaning that they are free to try to block Britain's busiest motorway again.

item.title: Scott Morrison's first call before announcing historic AUKUS deal was to Jacinda Ardern
item.description: Jacinda Ardern has made it clear Australia's first ever nuclear submarines will not be welcome in New Zealand's waters, with Scott Morrison giving her a heads up before his bombshell announcement.

item.title: Terrifying moment drink-driver smashes Range Rover into speeding TRAIN at level crossing
item.description: Rail worker Michael Rochford, 27, collided with an LNER Azuma train near Doncaster on June 13 while behind the wheel of his Range Rover - causing £345,000 of damage.

item.title: How to make your bed like a luxury 5-star hotel
item.description: If you're looking for hotel-quality bed linen for less, then the Pizuna 400 Thread Count Cotton Duvet Set should be on your radar. According to Amazon shoppers, it doesn't get more...

item.title: Transgender man diagnosed with ovarian tumor which grew to a FOOT wide
item.description: An ultrasound revealed that Ezra Varley, 24, from Vancouver, had a non-cancerous 33cm tumour in his right ovary, which was so large medics 'couldn't see any of his organs'.

item.title: Prince William and Prince Harry are not ready to make up, expert claims
item.description: Royal author Duncan Larcombe told The Sun that Prince William, 39, did the 'bare minimum' to mark his brother's special day, after sharing pictures of them together in previous years.

item.title: Throwing shade! Defiant homeowner, 61, REFUSES to trim 65ft conifer trees
item.description: The huge trees have been a permanent fixture at John Rose's detached property for decades. Neighbours say they block their light but Mr Rose says they are needed to soak up water in the area.

item.title: Parents campaign to save teacher suspended after pupils complained he called them 'chicken sh***
item.description: They have written to the school to demand the teacher is allowed to keep his job at Gable Hall School in Corringham, Essex (pictured).

item.title: Fossils: Footprints discovered in Spain reveal a NURSERY for elephants from 129,000 years ago
item.description: Tracks on the 'Matalascañas Trampled Surface', which was preserved near the city of Huelva, Spain, were analysed by researchers led from the University of Lisbon.

item.title: Shipwrecked Venezuelan mother died of thirst despite drinking her own URINE while kids survived
item.description: Mariely Chacon, 40, sacrificed her own life to save those of her six-year-old son and two-year-old daughter by trying to stave off dehydration so they had a fighting chance of surviving the shipwreck.

item.title: The stunning winners of the 2021 Ocean Photography Awards
item.description: Showcasing the deep blue sea and the life within in all its beauty and complexity, photographers around the world swam through shark-infested waters and blooms of jellyfish to get the perfect shot.

item.title: VIDEO: Drunk driver collides with a lorry following 7-pint binge
item.description: Declan Webster, 32, and brothers Robert and Michael Bowyer, 33 and 27, pleaded guilty to dangerous driving following the incident in Chesterfield, Derbyshire on August 5, 2020.

item.title: VIDEO: Runaway bin lorry narrowly misses dog walker
item.description: The bin lorry was on its round on Wednesday morning in Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, when it rolled down hill out of control before destroying a garden wall and hitting two cars.

item.title: 1,700 troops thrown out of the armed forces over past three years for taking cocaine
item.description: The data, released after a freedom of information request, shows that between June 2020 and May this year, 277 soldiers tested positive for the Class A drug.

item.title: VIDEO: Swindon cyclist punched in the face during road rage incident
item.description: Ady Short was on a ride last month with his wife and six members of the Swindon Wheelers bike club when he was punched in the face by a man during a road rage incident.

item.title: University student, 22, took his own life in university halls after he was accused of plagiarism
item.description: Alistair Hall, 22, was found dead in his student halls in Portsmouth, Hampshire, on June 27, 2020. He had suffered a heart arrhythmia having taken an overdose of a drug that he ordered online.

item.title: Van Gogh drawing spent years hidden goes on public display for the first time in Amsterdam
item.description: A rare new early artwork by Van Gogh November 1882 was discovered in a Dutch private collection and will go on display in the artist's museum in Amsterdam from Friday until January 2.

item.title: CCTV operator stopped Iraqi asylum seeker raping a woman by shouting over loudspeaker
item.description: Iraqi asylum seeker Turkey Al-Turkey (pictured), 26, got the woman unconscious before dragging her off a park bench to rape her on a lawn in Swansea.

item.title: Loose Women's Carol McGiffin and Kéllé Bryan row over whether small children should wear Covid masks
item.description: The panel discussed the topic following news that children New York will soon have to wear masks at daycare facilities, and Kéllé Bryan said that her children, aged 7 and 9 are 'comfortable' with masks.

item.title: Sturgeon calls in the army to help with Scottish ambulance crisis
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon has officially appealed for support from the military to deal with pressure - but still refused to admit that the situation is a 'crisis'.

item.title: Billions could be pumped into Barrow as part of deal to build new fleet of Australian nuclear subs
item.description: The Prime Minister told the Commons today that the new security partnership between London, Washington and Canberra - dubbed 'AUKUS' - is expected to deliver a much-needed jobs boost.

item.title: Japan draws 'red line' around disputed islands and warns China it will 'resolutely' defend them
item.description: Nobuo Kishi said the territories, known as the Diaoyu Islands in China, unquestionably belong to Japan and warned any provocation from Beijing will be fully matched.

item.title: Man died from fatal self-inflicted 'neck wound' after stabbing girlfriend to death, inquest hears
item.description: Police believe Benjamin Green, 41, stabbed his 22-year-old girlfriend Maddie Durdant-Hollamby to death at his Kettering home before turning the blade on himself in a gruesome murder-suicide.

item.title: Semi-autobiographical dark comedy by Sophie Willan follows woman who becomes an escort
item.description: The semi-autobiographical series, set in Sophie Willan's hometown of Bolton, was penned by the comedian and has won praise from viewers who enjoyed the show despite it's 'bleak subject matter'.

item.title: Bride who was quoted £30,000 for a castle wedding reveals how she cut costs to £9,000
item.description: Ashly Waugh and her fiance Luke, from Hexham, couldn't afford the £30,000 they were quoted to have a castle wedding, but cut costs by having fake flowers and getting the cake as a wedding gift.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 13, forced to isolate over trousers that showed her ankles
item.description: Olivia Harrison, 13, said she was ordered to change into clothes from lost property by a staff member at John Smeaton Academy, Leeds, during lunchtime on Monday.

item.title: Countdown's Rachel Riley doesn't know where to look as letters spell out SLUT on the board
item.description: Countdown maths whiz Rachel Riley didn't know which way to look as one of the show's contestant's inadvertently spelled out 'slut' on the board on Thursday's episode.

item.title: Care home residents are still 'dying of loneliness' says West End star Ruthie Henshall
item.description: Ruthie Henshall was one of dozens of campaigners from the Rights for Residents group who gathered outside Downing Street calling for an end to the isolation of residents.

item.title: JANET STREET-PORTER: Boris's sham reshuffle will serve no purpose other than making him look good
item.description: JANET STREET-PORTER: Boris Johnson's much-vaunted Cabinet reshuffle will have as much impact on ordinary voters as reshuffling the deckchairs on the Titanic.

item.title: AUKUS submarine deal with sealed at the G7 summit
item.description: The meeting was the culmination of an 18-month plot by Mr Morrison to acquire nuclear submarine technology, and ended with Australia getting its hands on at least eight vessels.

item.title: Is 'maintenance sex' the answer to post-pandemic low libido?
item.description: Surrey-based GP Dr Anisha Patel was on the Lorraine show today to discuss why many people have lost their libido as a result of the pandemic - and what they can do to resolve it.

item.title: Lorry drivers are offered £70,000-a-year and £2,000 'golden hellos'
item.description: A trucker called Barney from Milton Keynes was offered five night shifts a week paying £27-per-hour, with time-and-a-half for Saturdays and double-time for Sundays.

item.title: John Lewis looks to lure Christmas workers with free bacon and eggs
item.description: The John Lewis Partnership said that it would take on 2,000 more temporary staff than last year for a bumper festive season.

item.title: Unvaccinated mother, 55, and daughter, 32, both die of Covid
item.description: Sammie-Jo Forde, 32, died in Ulster Hospital near Belfast last Saturday, only 11 days after her mother Heather Maddern, 55, passed away in the same ward on August 31.

item.title: Periods affected by Covid jabs normally resort back to normal after one irregular cycle, say experts
item.description: Dr Jackie Maybin, a consultant gynaecologist at Edinburgh University, said other jabs were known to disrupt periods and that they have had no noticeable impact on fertility.

item.title: Tim Davie defends hiring anti-Brexit left-winger Jess Brammar
item.description: The corporation has been accused of creating a new non-job for Ms Brammar, who has deleted all her tweets including ones critics said showed she had 'biased' left-wing views.

item.title: UK's 'Tax Gap' rises for the first time in six years to £35billion
item.description: The difference between the tax expected and what was actually paid was equivalent to 5.3 per cent in 2019-20, official figures showed.

item.title: Humans may have started making clothes 120,000 years ago, scientists say
item.description: Archaeologists have found ancient bone tools in the Contrebandiers Cave in Morocco that they believe were used to work leather and fur into garments between 90,000 and 120,000 years ago.

item.title: Statins don't just lower cholesterol! Study finds cheap pills may also help treat ulcerative colitis
item.description: Stanford University researchers have found that atrorvastatin - sold under the name Lipitor for just 54p a pill - slashes the risk of being hospitalised with the painful condition by half.

item.title: Michaela Strachan's rant about £2,250 quarantine hotel backfires
item.description: Michaela Strachan's Twitter rant about the £2250 quarantine hotel where she is staying after flying into the UK from South Africa has backfired somewhat.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain looks effortlessly chic in red silk gown and killer heels
item.description: Looking typically polished, Letizia of Spain, 49, donned a red silk gown featuring button detailing on the sleeves and a cinched waist teamed with a pair of matching slingback heels.

item.title: England star Reece James posts moment 'robbers raided his house'
item.description: Reece James, 21, was playing for Chelsea on Tuesday evening when a gang of thieves broke into his house and stole a safe with his Champions League and England medals inside.

item.title: New Tube map is unveiled showing Nine Elms and Battersea Power Station on the Northern Line
item.description: The map features two new stations - Nine Elms and Battersea Power Station - which make up the Northern line extension in south London. Trains will begin serving them from around 5.30am Monday.

item.title: Dorset Police launch witness and information appeal for missing teenager Aydin Kolliari
item.description: 14-year-old Aydin Kolliari was last spotted in the Holdenhurst Road area of Bournemouth in Dorset on Friday, September 10 - prompting a police appeal for information and witnesses.

item.title: Moment police officer PUNCHES drinker in the FACE during frenzied tussle to arrest him outside pub
item.description: Video filmed by a bystander shows two police officers trying to arrest Stephen Dawe, 42, outside the Tadcross Hotel in Barry, South Wales after he allegedly called one of them a 'd**khead'.

item.title: Mother arrested after hunt when she failed to appear in court over charges she killed her children
item.description: Mary McCann, 35, of Derby, failed to appear before Aylesbury Crown Court on Friday to answer two charges of causing death by dangerous driving and an arrest warrant was issued.

item.title: Sacked software engineer who tried to sue aerospace company boss for racism has claim thrown out
item.description: Dr Fazal Ahmad was sacked by Rosemount Aerospace, based in Malvern, Worcestershire, after just four months for failing to develop a prototype artificial intelligence system.

item.title: Married at First Sight cast have TEN reality show appearances between them
item.description: The 16 singletons who signed up to the show all said they were looking for love, with many saying they'd had a series of unsuccessful romances in the past but are they really looking for love?

item.title: Schoolgirl has to bat off strangers who always want to touch her frizzy locks or call her untidy
item.description: Florence's parents Jill Peddie-Jones, 43, and Kyle Patteson, 49, from Newcastle, have taught their daughter Florence, 6, to 'tell off' strangers who commen ton her hair and try to touch it.

item.title: Care homes say they will have to shut or break the law by keeping on unvaccinated staff
item.description: Unions and care bosses have warned of a staffing exodus in English care homes due to the requirement for carers to be vaccinated with two doses by November 11.

item.title: The Great Bronze Age migration was fuelled by milk, study finds
item.description: Some nomads, known as the Yamnaya, went west across Europe to places such as Scandinavia, while others got as far east as Mongolia. They brought with them new languages and technologies.

item.title: Sky is back online following outage that left customers in Scotland unable to access the internet
item.description: Sky is back online following a two-hour outage that left users across East and Central Scotland unable to access the internet.

item.title: Dundee: How the city would have looked 20,000 years ago under a 0.6-mile-thick ICE SHEET
item.description: The video was made by glaciologist Max Van Wyk de Vries of the University of Minnesota and design expert Kieran Duncan of the University of Dundee.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan transform Archewell website - and ditch their 'shared compassion' tagline
item.description: Prince Harry, 37, and Meghan Markle, 40, who are living in their $14 million mansion in California, have given their website a makeover. It now features an image of them prominently.

item.title: Global warming 'danger limit' of 2.7°F could be breached in just five YEARS
item.description: The pandemic caused only a temporary downturn in CO2 emissions last year and it was not enough to reverse rising levels of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, the UN report warned.

item.title: African ISIS leader blown up by a French drone strike riding on a motorbike four years after ambush
item.description: ISIS leader Adnan Abu Walid al-Sahrawi was killed in August by a French drone strike after being tracked by counter-terrorism forces in northern Mali, authorities confirmed on Thursday.

item.title: Covid has caused biggest drop in life expectancy in England since PHE records began in the 1980s
item.description: Public Health England said the 'very high level' of additional fatalities in 2020 caused life expectancy for men to drop by 1.3 years to 78.7 years, while women dropped 0.9 years to 82.7 years.

item.title: The champion returns! Teen tennis ace Emma Raducanu is back in the UK
item.description: Ian, is the motor behind Emma's tennis drive, lifted her arm victoriously aloft and then hugged his 18-year-old daughter - but her mother Renee did not come out to pose with the sports superstar.

item.title: Fossils: School kids find remains of 4ft 7in penguin that roamed New Zealand 34 million years ago
item.description: Kairuku waewaeroa - which lived some 34.6-27.3 million years ago and stood at 4' 6" tall - was first unearthed in the Kawhia Harbour, on the North Island, in 2006.

item.title: North Korea reveals its TRAIN-based missile system that fired two missiles towards Japan this week
item.description: The missiles were launched from a new 'railway-borne missile system' designed as a potential counter-strike to any forces that threaten the country, KCNA reported on Thursday.

item.title: Facebook quietly changed its algorithm in 2018 to prioritise reshared material
item.description: The US tech giant's CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the change was made in an attempt to strengthen bonds between users - particularly family and friends - and to improve their wellbeing.

item.title: Three-bed property on South Kensington mews set behind Grade II-listed arches on sale for £3.95m
item.description: The three-bedroom home is situated in Kynance Mews, in leafy South Kensington, which is regarded as a favourite among social media influencers due to its Grade II listed arches

item.title: VIDEO: Driver almost wipes out pedestrians while overtaking a truck
item.description: Jamie Brown was driving his truck through Burton upon Trent on September 9 when he was overtaken at traffic lights by a Citroen C4 which then almost struck a group of three people crossing the road.

item.title: Mother, 41, accused of murdering five-year-old daughter showed 'no emotion' as she appeared in court
item.description: Martina Madarova, who allegedly murdered her daughter Alijah Thomas, at the family's home in Ealing, West London on Tuesday, showed no visible emotion when she appeared in court today.

item.title: Liam and Noel Gallagher's estranged father faces being homeless after losing his Manchester property
item.description: Tommy Gallagher, 77, embroiled in a legal dispute over the fate of his semi-detached home in Burnage, where the Wonderwall hitmakers grew up. Judge ruled he was the victim of 'fraud'.

item.title: Relief for Staffordshire village as Environment Agency is ordered to reduce noxious gases
item.description: Lawyers for Mathew Richards argued there is a 'public health emergency' in the vicinity of Walleys Quarry in Silverdale, affecting 'hundreds and probably thousands of local people'.

item.title: Covid cases in the UK fell by 9% last week to dip below 50,000 a day, symptom-tracking app claims
item.description: King's College London scientists estimated 47,276 people were catching Covid every day in the week to September 11, down slightly from the same time last week.

item.title: Tragedy as ITV News Editor Geoff Hill, 52, dies of leukaemia
item.description: Geoff Hill, of Lee, South East London, married his wife Natalie in a quickly-arranged ceremony at the Clarendon Hotel in Blackheath last December with only 13 guests.

item.title: Almost 90% of all 16-24 year olds now have Covid antibodies, official data suggests
item.description: The Office for National Statistics, which carried out blood tests on youngsters across the UK's four nations, found between 87 and 89 per cent of them had Covid-fighting antibodies.

item.title: Topps Tiles founder breaks record for the most expensive mansion sold in Sandbanks
item.description: Harbour Gate sold for a whopping £10m, almost £2m more than the previous record selling price on the millionaire's playground in Poole Harbour, Dorset.

item.title: Tragedy as Nick the lonely bottlenose dolphin dies after being hit by a boat
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Nick the bottlenose dolphin has been found dead after being hit by a boat in Ireland. He had delighted swimmers in August after approaching them.

item.title: Woman arrested in Waitrose for not wearing a face mask sues Sussex Police for 'wrongful' arrest
item.description: Juliet Johnson now plans to sue Sussex Police after she was arrested, questioned and strip-searched over not wearing a face covering while shopping in Waitrose in Chichester, West Sussex.

item.title: Marks & Spencer will close 11 stores in France due to supply crisis
item.description: Britain's biggest high street retailer has suffered over the Channel in recent months after stringent European border restrictions left its Paris shops with empty shelves.

item.title: Pregnant teenager fighting for her life after car 'driven by a 15-year-old boy' smashed into tram
item.description: The 17-year-old was a passenger in a silver Vauxhall which collided with the tram in Wolverhampton, West Midlands. Paramedics said the girl was found with 'life-threatening' injuries.

item.title: WFH forever: More than two-thirds of people don't believe workers will return to office full time
item.description: Around 70% of Britons surveyed by YouGov said workers would 'never return to offices at the same rate' as before the pandemic.

item.title: China threatens to sail its navy into Hawaiian waters as US and Australia announce defence pact
item.description: A guided-missile cruiser, guided-missile destroyer, general intelligence vessel, and an auxiliary vessel were spotted off the coast of Alaska's Aleutian Islands during surveillance operations.

item.title: Police officer, 51, had sexual relationships with two women he met while on duty, court hears
item.description: Paul Chadwick, 51, of Churchwood, Pontypool, appeared at Newport Magistrates Court charged with two counts of misconduct in public office amounting to an abuse of public trust.

item.title: British teenager convicted of 'making up' gang rape ordeal in Cyprus launches appeal
item.description: The woman, who was 19 at the time of her trial, was given a suspended sentenced for allegedly making up claims that she was abused by a dozen Israelis during a vacation in Cyprus in 2019.

item.title: Is Harry and Meghan's Time shoot inspired by their trip to New Zealand?
item.description: An image from TIme's photoshoot bares striking similarities to a picture of the couple taken in 2018, just days after they announced they were expecting baby Archie during New Zealand trip.

item.title: Meghan Markle donned fellow Angeleno's Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen's The Row for Time 100
item.description: Meghan Markle, 40, who is currently living in her $14 million mansion in California, posed in a green tonal outfit from Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen's label The Row for the Time 100 shoot.

item.title: Man, 37, 'randomly abducted' seven-year-old girl in south London, court hears
item.description: Darren Colly, 37, is accused of randomly grabbing a girl and running down the street in October last year. Westminster Magistrates Court heard he then put her down and fled the scene.

item.title: Dominic Raab and Gavin Williamson axed: But what took Boris so long to send them packing?
item.description: Dominic Raab was removed as Foreign Secretary in the wake of his handling of the crisis in Afghanistan. Gavin Williamson was sacked as Education Secretary after his calamitous tenure.

item.title: Call The Midwife star Megan Cusack rushed to hospital and given 17 stitches after TRIC Awards fall
item.description: The actress, who plays Nancy Corrigan on the hit BBC drama was pictured leaving the London venue in a wheelchair having injured her leg and ankle

item.title: A first wedding snap! James and Alizee Middleton look overjoyed after nuptials
item.description: In a photograph posted by the Mayor of Bormes-les-Mimosas online, Alizee, 32, could be seen wearing a floor length off-the shoulder gown, while James, 34, beamed at the camera.

item.title: Queen will miss this year's Chelsea Flower Show for the first time since 2005
item.description: The event at The Royal Hospital Chelsea will take place in September rather than May for the first time, and since Her Majesty's Coronation 68 years ago, it will be only the tenth time she's missed it.

item.title: Elton John, 74, POSTPONES his farewell tour for two years after a fall
item.description: The statement read: 'It is with great sadness and a heavy heart that I am forced to reschedule the 2021 dates of my Farewell Yellow Brick Road tour in Europe and the UK to 2023'

item.title: VIDEO: Seagull lands on a whale's back and begins to surf
item.description: Leandro Hihn, 30, filmed the amazing video in Puerto Piramides, Argentina last month. He was following a southern right whale which breached the surface.

item.title: SpaceX shares video of the window on its Crew Dragon capsule as it begins three-day orbit of Earth
item.description: The Inspiration4 crew - including Jared Isaacman, Hayley Arceneaux, Sian Proctor and Chris Sembroski - launched into space last night from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida.

item.title: 'So why did I have to leave?' Piers Morgan to ITV boss who said she 'vigorously' defended him
item.description: Piers Morgan shared an article on Twitter reporting on his former boss's comments last night, asking her: 'So why did I have to leave?', next to a laughing emoji.

item.title: Sunny 75F will make Britain hotter than the south of France tomorrow before heat ebbs
item.description: The Met Office said there will be sunny spells across the UK today before mercury rises tomorrow beyond even the 71F expected in Faro in Portugal, the 66F due in Madrid, and 73F in Nice.

item.title: Cat lover dubbed 'Mr Catmando' who lives with 70 felines is being investigated by police and RSPCA
item.description: Ian 'Catmando' lives with more than 70 cats at his home in Lincolnshire and estimates he has cared for more than 5,000 since 1992 but insists he is doing nothing wrong and they are well looked after

item.title: Mother who quit her architect career to study black magic found dead with daughter in ritual killing
item.description: The bodies of Elizaveta Tsarevskaya, 32, and her baby girl, one, were found with stab wounds in a 'black magic' ritual killing in an apartment in Rostov-on-Don, Russia.

item.title: Bake Off's Freya Cox is forced off social media by trolls who slam her love of horse riding
item.description: The psychology student, 19, was forced to delete a Facebook page called Freya Cox Eventing, which had documented her achievements in the sport.

item.title: Chances of alien life in our galaxy are 'much more likely than first thought', scientists claim
item.description: These organic molecules resulted in life on Earth, and are 100 times more abundant than previously thought, according to research led by the University of Leeds.

item.title: Ursula von der Leyen reignites vaccine row with UK
item.description: Ursula von der Leyen has claimed victory in the race to rollout coronavirus vaccines as she took a swipe at Boris Johnson by saying 'a pandemic is a marathon, not a sprint'.

item.title: Designer transforms dreary 70s-style house into vibrant colourful home
item.description: Rachel Henderson, 40, and her husband Andrew, 34, moved into their home in Fife in February 2020, and were keen to switch out the old-fashioned decor for something bold and quirky.

item.title: Ex counter terror chief: Shamima Begum should be treated as a terrorist not a lost gap year student
item.description: Richard Walton, who was head of Counterterrorism at the Metropolitan Police between 2011 and 2016, said Thursday that Shamima Begum must be treated 'like the terrorist she is'.

item.title: A matchmaking astrologer has revealed the best sex positions and styles for each signs
item.description: Lucy Porter, 27, from London, runs an astrology matchmaking service, and is no stranger to knowing intimate details about her clients, says there's a link betwen the zodiac and sexual preferences.

item.title: BBC and ITV will be ordered to make more 'distinctively British' shows
item.description: In a speech to the Royal Television Society Cambridge Convention, junior minister John Whittingdale said that the government wanted to ensure British content wasn't 'watered down'.

item.title: Former child refugee Nadhim Zahawi who arrived in Britain aged nine is the new Education Secretary
item.description: Nadhim Zahawi, who arrived in Britain as a nine-year-old boy unable to speak English, was promoted to Education Secretary yesterday, replacing Gavin Williamson.

item.title: 'Moderate' Taliban leader Abdul Baradar appears on Afghan TV to deny rumours of his death
item.description: The Islamist group had descended into bitter in-fighting with so-called 'moderates' thought to be at war with terrorist hardliners as both vie for power in the vacuum left by America's retreat.

item.title: Social media users from around the world share some of the funniest signs they've ever seen
item.description: In a new online gallery curated by Bored Panda, social media users shared snaps of hilarious signs they'd found from around the world, including a pub describing itself as 3D Tinder.

item.title: Doctors blast 'dangerous' TikTok trend of women removing their own contraceptive coils on video
item.description: Women from around the world who are struggling to book appointments with their doctor or gynaecologist are resorting to doing it themselves and posting 'IUD removal' videos.

item.title: Homes you can let in the top 10 UK rental hotspots revealed
item.description: Rental shortages are so acute that in some towns and villages in these areas, there is only one property available to rent on Rightmove.

item.title: Two women, 23, tell how they were swapped at birth in hospital mix-up
item.description: Caterina Alagna and Melissa Fodera, both 23, from Sicily, who were accidentally swapped at birth and brought up as sisters by their families have detailed their unique journey in a book and film.

item.title: Careers expert: The four things employers wish they could say about your cover letter
item.description: Sue Ellson, from Melbourne, said job seekers should always write a new cover letter for every job application, be clear and concise and address it to a specific person.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... soft-touch policing
item.description: 'Last warning - one more hoot disturbing these guys' lunch and you're ALL under arrest'

item.title: Who'll find love on our blind date? This week it's Lucy, 35, and Jo, 40
item.description: Every week, FEMAIL asks two singletons to report back from their blind date. Personal trainer Lucy, 35, and Jo, 40, who live in the UK, shared their experience.

item.title: Sports Direct, Webuyanycar and Saga are fined £450K after sending 354 million nuisance messages
item.description: None of the companies had gained permission to send marketing emails or texts from the people in the UK who received them. This is against the law, said the Information Commissioner's Office.
item.media:description: Companies including Sports Direct sent emails or texts without proper consent from recipients (Lauren Hurley/PA)

item.title: Monkeys kill again in India: Marauding primates chase a politician's wife off roof top to her death
item.description: Sushma Devi, 50, wife of Anil Kumar Chauhan, leader of the Indian Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), was rushed to hospital but died of her injuries.

item.title: Covid US: Nearly HALF of women trying to get pregnant have paused plans for motherhood
item.description: Many women who were planning or even actively trying to get pregnant before the COVID-19 pandemic have since dropped their plans, a new study by NYU Langone Medical Center found.

item.title: Life-size camel carvings in Saudi Arabia are almost TWICE the age of Stonehenge
item.description: Life-size camel sculptures in Saudi Arabia that were thought to be 2,000 years old actually date back 8,000 years, new analysis by the Max Planck Institute for the Science of Human History has revealed.
